summary.long: 2 Corinthians is a book of the New Testament.

verses.text:
Paul, an apostle of Christ Jesus by the will of God, and our brother Timothy,
To the church of God which is at Corinth with all the saints who are throughout Achaia:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Grace to you and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Blessed be the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, the Father of mercies and God of all comfort,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who comforts us in all our affliction so that we will be able to comfort those who are in any affliction with the comfort with which we ourselves are comforted by God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For just as the sufferings of Christ are ours in abundance, so also our comfort is abundant through Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if we are afflicted, it is for your comfort and salvation; or if we are comforted, it is for your comfort, which is effective in the patient enduring of the same sufferings which we also suffer;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and our hope for you is firmly grounded, knowing that as you are partners in our sufferings, so also you are in our comfort.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For we do not want you to be unaware, brothers and sisters, of our affliction which occurred in Asia, that we were burdened excessively, beyond our strength, so that we despaired even of life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Indeed, we had the sentence of death within ourselves so that we would not trust in ourselves, but in God who raises the dead,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who rescued us from so great a danger of death, and will rescue us, He on whom we have set our hope. And He will yet deliver us,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: if you also join in helping us through your prayers, so that thanks may be given by many persons in our behalf for the favor granted to us through the prayers of many.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For our proud confidence is this: the testimony of our conscience, that in holiness and godly sincerity, not in fleshly wisdom but in the grace of God, we have conducted ourselves in the world, and especially toward you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For we write nothing else to you than what you read and understand, and I hope you will understand until the end;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: just as you also partially did understand us, that we are your reason to be proud as you also are ours, on the day of our Lord Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In this confidence I intended at first to come to you, so that you might twice receive a blessing;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that is, to pass your way into Macedonia, and again from Macedonia to come to you, and by you to be helped on my journey to Judea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, I was not vacillating when I intended to do this, was I? Or what I decide, do I decide according to the flesh, so that with me there will be yes, yes and no, no at the same time?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But as God is faithful, our word to you is not yes and no.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the Son of God, Christ Jesus, who was preached among you by us—by me and Silvanus and Timothy—was not yes and no, but has been yes in Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For as many as the promises of God are, in Him they are yes; therefore through Him also is our Amen to the glory of God through us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now He who establishes us with you in Christ and anointed us is God,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who also sealed us and gave us the Spirit in our hearts as a pledge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I call God as witness to my soul, that it was to spare you that I did not come again to Corinth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Not that we domineer over your faith, but we are workers with you for your joy; for in your faith you are standing firm.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I decided this for my own sake, that I would not come to you in sorrow again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For if I cause you sorrow, who then will be the one making me glad but the one who is made sorrowful by me?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the very thing I wrote you, so that when I came, I would not have sorrow from those who ought to make me rejoice; having confidence in you all that my joy was the joy of you all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For out of much affliction and anguish of heart I wrote to you with many tears; not so that you would be made sorrowful, but that you might know the love which I have especially for you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if anyone has caused sorrow, he has caused sorrow not for me, but in some degree—not to say too much—for all of you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Sufficient for such a person is this punishment which was imposed by the majority,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so that on the other hand, you should rather forgive and comfort him, otherwise such a person might be overwhelmed by excessive sorrow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore I urge you to reaffirm your love for him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For to this end I also wrote, so that I might put you to the test, whether you are obedient in all things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But one whom you forgive anything, I also forgive; for indeed what I have forgiven, if I have forgiven anything, I did so for your sakes in the presence of Christ,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so that no advantage would be taken of us by Satan, for we are not ignorant of his schemes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when I came to Troas for the gospel of Christ and when a door was opened for me in the Lord,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I had no rest for my spirit, not finding Titus my brother; but saying goodbye to them, I went on to Macedonia.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But thanks be to God, who always leads us in triumph in Christ, and through us reveals the fragrance of the knowledge of Him in every place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For we are a fragrance of Christ to God among those who are being saved and among those who are perishing:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to the one an aroma from death to death, to the other an aroma from life to life. And who is adequate for these things?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For we are not like the many, peddling the word of God, but as from sincerity, but as from God, we speak in Christ in the sight of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Are we beginning to commend ourselves again? Or do we need, as some, letters of commendation to you or from you?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are our letter, written in our hearts, known and read by all people,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: revealing yourselves, that you are a letter of Christ, delivered by us, written not with ink but with the Spirit of the living God, not on tablets of stone but on tablets of human hearts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Such is the confidence we have toward God through Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Not that we are adequate in ourselves so as to consider anything as having come from ourselves, but our adequacy is from God,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who also made us adequate as servants of a new covenant, not of the letter but of the Spirit; for the letter kills, but the Spirit gives life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if the ministry of death, engraved in letters on stones, came with glory so that the sons of Israel could not look intently at the face of Moses because of the glory of his face, fading as it was,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: how will the ministry of the Spirit fail to be even more with glory?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For if the ministry of condemnation has glory, much more does the ministry of righteousness excel in glory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For indeed what had glory in this case has no glory, because of the glory that surpasses it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For if that which fades away was with glory, much more that which remains is in glory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, having such a hope, we use great boldness in our speech,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and we are not like Moses, who used to put a veil over his face so that the sons of Israel would not stare at the end of what was fading away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But their minds were hardened; for until this very day at the reading of the old covenant the same veil remains unlifted, because it is removed in Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But to this day whenever Moses is read, a veil lies over their hearts;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but whenever someone turns to the Lord, the veil is taken away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the Lord is the Spirit, and where the Spirit of the Lord is, there is freedom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But we all, with unveiled faces, looking as in a mirror at the glory of the Lord, are being transformed into the same image from glory to glory, just as from the Lord, the Spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, since we have this ministry, as we received mercy, we do not lose heart,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but we have renounced the things hidden because of shame, not walking in trickery nor distorting the word of God, but by the open proclamation of the truth commending ourselves to every person’s conscience in the sight of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And even if our gospel is veiled, it is veiled to those who are perishing,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: in whose case the god of this world has blinded the minds of the unbelieving so that they will not see the light of the gospel of the glory of Christ, who is the image of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For we do not preach ourselves, but Christ Jesus as Lord, and ourselves as your bond-servants on account of Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For God, who said, “Light shall shine out of darkness,” is the One who has shone in our hearts to give the Light of the knowledge of the glory of God in the face of Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But we have this treasure in earthen containers, so that the extraordinary greatness of the power will be of God and not from ourselves;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: we are afflicted in every way, but not crushed; perplexed, but not despairing;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: persecuted, but not abandoned; struck down, but not destroyed;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: always carrying around in the body the dying of Jesus, so that the life of Jesus may also be revealed in our body.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For we who live are constantly being handed over to death because of Jesus, so that the life of Jesus may also be revealed in our mortal flesh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So death works in us, but life in you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But having the same spirit of faith, according to what is written: “I believed, therefore I spoke,” we also believe, therefore we also speak,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: knowing that He who raised the Lord Jesus will also raise us with Jesus, and will present us with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For all things are for your sakes, so that grace, having spread to more and more people, will cause thanksgiving to overflow to the glory of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore we do not lose heart, but though our outer person is decaying, yet our inner person is being renewed day by day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For our momentary, light affliction is producing for us an eternal weight of glory far beyond all comparison,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: while we look not at the things which are seen, but at the things which are not seen; for the things which are seen are temporal, but the things which are not seen are eternal.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For we know that if our earthly tent which is our house is torn down, we have a building from God, a house not made by hands, eternal in the heavens.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For indeed, in this tent we groan, longing to be clothed with our dwelling from heaven,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: since in fact after putting it on, we will not be found naked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For indeed, we who are in this tent groan, being burdened, because we do not want to be unclothed but to be clothed, so that what is mortal will be swallowed up by life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now He who prepared us for this very purpose is God, who gave us the Spirit as a pledge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, being always of good courage, and knowing that while we are at home in the body we are absent from the Lord—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for we walk by faith, not by sight—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but we are of good courage and prefer rather to be absent from the body and to be at home with the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore we also have as our ambition, whether at home or absent, to be pleasing to Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For we must all appear before the judgment seat of Christ, so that each one may receive compensation for his deeds done through the body, in accordance with what he has done, whether good or bad.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, knowing the fear of the Lord, we persuade people, but we are well known to God; and I hope that we are also well known in your consciences.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We are not commending ourselves to you again, but are giving you an opportunity to be proud of us, so that you will have an answer for those who take pride in appearance and not in heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For if we have lost our minds, it is for God; if we are of sound mind, it is for you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the love of Christ controls us, having concluded this, that one died for all, therefore all died;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and He died for all, so that those who live would no longer live for themselves, but for Him who died and rose on their behalf.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore from now on we recognize no one by the flesh; even though we have known Christ by the flesh, yet now we know Him in this way no longer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore if anyone is in Christ, this person is a new creation; the old things passed away; behold, new things have come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now all these things are from God, who reconciled us to Himself through Christ and gave us the ministry of reconciliation,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: namely, that God was in Christ reconciling the world to Himself, not counting their wrongdoings against them, and He has committed to us the word of reconciliation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, we are ambassadors for Christ, as though God were making an appeal through us; we beg you on behalf of Christ, be reconciled to God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He made Him who knew no sin to be sin in our behalf, so that we might become the righteousness of God in Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And working together with Him, we also urge you not to receive the grace of God in vain—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
for He says,
“At a favorable time I listened to you,
And on a day of salvation I helped you.”
Behold, now is “a favorable time,” behold, now is “a day of salvation”—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: giving no reason for taking offense in anything, so that the ministry will not be discredited,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but in everything commending ourselves as servants of God, in much endurance, in afflictions, in hardships, in difficulties,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: in beatings, in imprisonments, in mob attacks, in labors, in sleeplessness, in hunger,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: in purity, in knowledge, in patience, in kindness, in the Holy Spirit, in genuine love,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: in the word of truth, and in the power of God; by the weapons of righteousness for the right hand and the left,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: by glory and dishonor, by evil report and good report; regarded as deceivers and yet true;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: as unknown and yet well known, as dying and yet behold, we are alive; as punished and yet not put to death,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: as sorrowful yet always rejoicing, as poor yet making many rich, as having nothing and yet possessing all things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Our mouth has spoken freely to you, you Corinthians, our heart is opened wide.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are not restrained by us, but you are restrained in your own affections.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now in the same way in exchange—I am speaking as to children—open wide your hearts to us, you as well.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not be mismatched with unbelievers; for what do righteousness and lawlessness share together, or what does light have in common with darkness?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Or what harmony does Christ have with Belial, or what does a believer share with an unbeliever?
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
And I will be a father to you,
And you shall be sons and daughters to Me,”
Says the Lord Almighty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, having these promises, beloved, let’s cleanse ourselves from all defilement of flesh and spirit, perfecting holiness in the fear of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Make room for us in your hearts; we have wronged no one, we corrupted no one, we have taken advantage of no one.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I do not speak to condemn you, for I have said before that you are in our hearts, to die together and to live together.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My confidence in you is great; my boasting in your behalf is great. I am filled with comfort; I am overflowing with joy in all our affliction.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For even when we came into Macedonia our flesh had no rest, but we were afflicted on every side: conflicts on the outside, fears inside.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But God, who comforts the discouraged, comforted us by the arrival of Titus;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and not only by his arrival, but also by the comfort with which he was comforted among you, as he reported to us your longing, your mourning, your zeal for me; so that I rejoiced even more.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For though I caused you sorrow by my letter, I do not regret it; though I did regret it—for I see that that letter caused you sorrow, though only for a while—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I now rejoice, not that you were made sorrowful, but that you were made sorrowful to the point of repentance; for you were made sorrowful according to the will of God, so that you might not suffer loss in anything through us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the sorrow that is according to the will of God produces a repentance without regret, leading to salvation, but the sorrow of the world produces death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For behold what earnestness this very thing, this godly sorrow, has produced in you: what vindication of yourselves, what indignation, what fear, what longing, what zeal, what punishment of wrong! In everything you demonstrated yourselves to be innocent in the matter.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So although I wrote to you, it was not for the sake of the offender nor for the sake of the one offended, but that your earnestness in our behalf might be made known to you in the sight of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Because of this, we have been comforted.
And besides our comfort, we rejoiced even much more for the joy of Titus, because his spirit has been refreshed by you all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For if I have boasted to him about you regarding anything, I was not put to shame. But as we spoke all things to you in truth, so also our boasting before Titus proved to be the truth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His affection abounds all the more toward you, as he remembers the obedience of you all, how you received him with fear and trembling.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I rejoice that in everything I have confidence in you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now, brothers and sisters, we make known to you the grace of God which has been given in the churches of Macedonia,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that in a great ordeal of affliction their abundance of joy and their deep poverty overflowed in the wealth of their liberality.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I testify that according to their ability, and beyond their ability, they gave voluntarily,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: begging us with much urging for the favor of participation in the support of the saints,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and this, not as we had expected, but they first gave themselves to the Lord and to us by the will of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So we urged Titus that as he had previously made a beginning, so he would also complete in you this gracious work as well.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But just as you excel in everything, in faith, speaking, knowledge, and in all earnestness and in the love we inspired in you, see that you also excel in this gracious work.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am not saying this as a command, but as proving, through the earnestness of others, the sincerity of your love as well.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For you know the grace of our Lord Jesus Christ, that though He was rich, yet for your sake He became poor, so that you through His poverty might become rich.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I give my opinion in this matter, for this is to your advantage, who were the first to begin a year ago not only to do this, but also to desire to do it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But now finish doing it also, so that just as there was the willingness to desire it, so there may be also the completion of it by your ability.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For if the willingness is present, it is acceptable according to what a person has, not according to what he does not have.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For this is not for the relief of others and for your hardship, but by way of equality—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: at this present time your abundance will serve as assistance for their need, so that their abundance also may serve as assistance for your need, so that there may be equality;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: as it is written: “The one who had gathered much did not have too much, and the one who had gathered little did not have too little.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But thanks be to God who puts the same earnestness in your behalf in the heart of Titus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For he not only accepted our appeal, but being himself very earnest, he has gone to you of his own accord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We have sent along with him the brother whose fame in the things of the gospel has spread through all the churches;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and not only that, but he has also been appointed by the churches to travel with us in this gracious work, which is being administered by us for the glory of the Lord Himself, and to show our readiness,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: taking precaution so that no one will discredit us in our administration of this generous gift;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for we have regard for what is honorable, not only in the sight of the Lord, but also in the sight of other people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We have sent with them our brother, whom we have often tested and found diligent in many things, but now even more diligent because of his great confidence in you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As for Titus, he is my partner and fellow worker among you; as for our brothers, they are messengers of the churches, a glory to Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, openly before the churches, show them the proof of your love and of our reason for boasting about you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For it is superfluous for me to write to you about this ministry to the saints;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for I know your willingness, of which I boast about you to the Macedonians, namely, that Achaia has been prepared since last year, and your zeal has stirred up most of them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I have sent the brothers, in order that our boasting about you may not prove empty in this case, so that, as I was saying, you will be prepared;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: otherwise, if any Macedonians come with me and find you unprepared, we—not to mention you—would be put to shame by this confidence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So I considered it necessary to urge the brothers that they go on ahead to you and arrange in advance your previously promised generous gift, that the same would be ready as a generous gift, and not as one grudgingly given due to greediness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now I say this: the one who sows sparingly will also reap sparingly, and the one who sows generously will also reap generously.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Each one must do just as he has decided in his heart, not reluctantly or under compulsion, for God loves a cheerful giver.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And God is able to make all grace overflow to you, so that, always having all sufficiency in everything, you may have an abundance for every good deed;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
as it is written:
“He scattered abroad, he gave to the poor,
His righteousness endures forever.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now He who supplies seed to the sower and bread for food will supply and multiply your seed for sowing and increase the harvest of your righteousness;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: you will be enriched in everything for all liberality, which through us is producing thanksgiving to God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the ministry of this service is not only fully supplying the needs of the saints, but is also overflowing through many thanksgivings to God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Because of the proof given by this ministry, they will glorify God for your obedience to your confession of the gospel of Christ and for the liberality of your contribution to them and to all,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: while they also, by prayer on your behalf, yearn for you because of the surpassing grace of God in you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thanks be to God for His indescribable gift!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now I, Paul, myself urge you by the meekness and gentleness of Christ—I who am meek when face to face with you, but bold toward you when absent!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I ask that when I am present I need not be bold with the confidence with which I intend to be courageous against some, who regard us as if we walked according to the flesh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For though we walk in the flesh, we do not wage battle according to the flesh,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for the weapons of our warfare are not of the flesh, but divinely powerful for the destruction of fortresses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We are destroying arguments and all arrogance raised against the knowledge of God, and we are taking every thought captive to the obedience of Christ,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and we are ready to punish all disobedience, whenever your obedience is complete.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are looking at things as they are outwardly. If anyone is confident in himself that he is Christ’s, have him consider this again within himself, that just as he is Christ’s, so too are we.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For if I boast somewhat more about our authority, which the Lord gave for building you up and not for destroying you, I will not be put to shame,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for I do not want to seem as if I would terrify you by my letters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For they say, “His letters are weighty and strong, but his personal presence is unimpressive and his speech contemptible.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Have such a person consider this, that what we are in word by letters when absent, such persons we are also in deed when present.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For we do not presume to rank or compare ourselves with some of those who commend themselves; but when they measure themselves by themselves and compare themselves with themselves, they have no understanding.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But we will not boast beyond our measure, but within the measure of the domain which God assigned to us as a measure, to reach even as far as you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For we are not overextending ourselves, as if we did not reach to you, for we were the first to come even as far as you in the gospel of Christ;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: not boasting beyond our measure, that is, in other people’s labors, but with the hope that as your faith grows, we will be, within our domain, enlarged even more by you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so as to preach the gospel even to the regions beyond you, and not to boast in what has been accomplished in the domain of another.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the one who boasts is to boast in the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For it is not the one who commends himself that is approved, but the one whom the Lord commends.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I wish that you would bear with me in a little foolishness; but indeed you are bearing with me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I am jealous for you with a godly jealousy; for I betrothed you to one husband, to present you as a pure virgin to Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I am afraid that, as the serpent deceived Eve by his trickery, your minds will be led astray from sincere and pure devotion to Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For if one comes and preaches another Jesus whom we have not preached, or you receive a different spirit which you have not received, or a different gospel which you have not accepted, this you tolerate very well!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I consider myself not in the least inferior to the most eminent apostles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But even if I am unskilled in speech, yet I am not so in knowledge; in fact, in every way we have made this evident to you in all things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Or did I commit a sin by humbling myself so that you might be exalted, because I preached the gospel of God to you without charge?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I robbed other churches by taking wages from them to serve you;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and when I was present with you and was in need, I was not a burden to anyone; for when the brothers came from Macedonia they fully supplied my need, and in everything I kept myself from being a burden to you, and will continue to do so.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As the truth of Christ is in me, this boasting of mine will not be stopped in the regions of Achaia.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Why? Because I do not love you? God knows that I do!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But what I am doing I will also continue to do, so that I may eliminate the opportunity from those who want an opportunity to be regarded just as we are in the matter about which they are boasting.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For such men are false apostles, deceitful workers, disguising themselves as apostles of Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No wonder, for even Satan disguises himself as an angel of light.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore it is not surprising if his servants also disguise themselves as servants of righteousness, whose end will be according to their deeds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Again I say, let no one think me foolish; but if you do, receive me even as foolish, so that I also may boast a little.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What I am saying, I am not saying as the Lord would, but as in foolishness, in this confidence of boasting.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Since many boast according to the flesh, I will boast also.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For you, being so wise, tolerate the foolish gladly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For you tolerate it if anyone enslaves you, if anyone devours you, if anyone takes advantage of you, if anyone exalts himself, if anyone hits you in the face.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
To my shame I must say that we have been weak by comparison.
But in whatever respect anyone else is bold—I am speaking in foolishness—I too am bold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Are they Hebrews? So am I. Are they Israelites? So am I. Are they descendants of Abraham? So am I.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Are they servants of Christ?—I am speaking as if insane—I more so; in far more labors, in far more imprisonments, beaten times without number, often in danger of death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Five times I received from the Jews thirty-nine lashes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Three times I was beaten with rods, once I was stoned, three times I was shipwrecked, a night and a day I have spent adrift at sea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have been on frequent journeys, in dangers from rivers, dangers from robbers, dangers from my countrymen, dangers from the Gentiles, dangers in the city, dangers in the wilderness, dangers at sea, dangers among false brothers;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have been in labor and hardship, through many sleepless nights, in hunger and thirst, often without food, in cold and exposure.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Apart from such external things, there is the daily pressure on me of concern for all the churches.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Who is weak without my being weak? Who is led into sin without my intense concern?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If I have to boast, I will boast of what pertains to my weakness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The God and Father of the Lord Jesus, He who is blessed forever, knows that I am not lying.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In Damascus the ethnarch under Aretas the king was guarding the city of the Damascenes in order to seize me,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and I was let down in a basket through a window in the wall, and so escaped his hands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Boasting is necessary, though it is not beneficial; but I will go on to visions and revelations of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I know a man in Christ, who fourteen years ago—whether in the body I do not know, or out of the body I do not know, God knows—such a man was caught up to the third heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I know how such a man—whether in the body or apart from the body I do not know, God knows—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: was caught up into Paradise and heard inexpressible words, which a man is not permitted to speak.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In behalf of such a man I will boast; but in my own behalf I will not boast, except regarding my weaknesses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For if I do wish to boast I will not be foolish, for I will be speaking the truth; but I refrain from this, so that no one will credit me with more than he sees in me or hears from me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Because of the extraordinary greatness of the revelations, for this reason, to keep me from exalting myself, there was given to me a thorn in the flesh, a messenger of Satan to torment me—to keep me from exalting myself!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Concerning this I pleaded with the Lord three times that it might leave me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And He has said to me, “My grace is sufficient for you, for power is perfected in weakness.” Most gladly, therefore, I will rather boast about my weaknesses, so that the power of Christ may dwell in me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore I delight in weaknesses, in insults, in distresses, in persecutions, in difficulties, in behalf of Christ; for when I am weak, then I am strong.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have become foolish; you yourselves compelled me. Actually I should have been commended by you, since I was in no respect inferior to the most eminent apostles, even though I am a nobody.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The distinguishing marks of a true apostle were performed among you with all perseverance, by signs, wonders, and miracles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For in what respect were you treated as inferior to the rest of the churches, except that I myself did not become a burden to you? Forgive me this wrong!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Here for this third time I am ready to come to you, and I will not be a burden to you; for I do not seek what is yours, but you; for children are not responsible to save up for their parents, but parents for their children.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will most gladly spend and be expended for your souls. If I love you more, am I to be loved less?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But be that as it may, I did not burden you myself; nevertheless, devious person that I am, I took you in by deceit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Certainly I have not taken advantage of you through any of those whom I have sent to you, have I?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I urged Titus to go, and I sent the brother with him. Titus did not take any advantage of you, did he? Did we not conduct ourselves in the same spirit and walk in the same steps?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All this time you have been thinking that we are defending ourselves to you. Actually, it is in the sight of God that we have been speaking in Christ; and all for building you up, beloved.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I am afraid that perhaps when I come I may find you to be not what I wish, and may be found by you to be not what you wish; that perhaps there will be strife, jealousy, angry tempers, selfishness, slanders, gossip, arrogance, disturbances;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am afraid that when I come again my God may humiliate me before you, and I may mourn over many of those who have sinned in the past and not repented of the impurity, sexual immorality, and indecent behavior which they have practiced.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the third time that I am coming to you. On the testimony of two or three witnesses every matter shall be confirmed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have previously said when I was present the second time, and though now absent I say in advance to those who have sinned in the past and to all the rest as well, that if I come again I will not spare anyone,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: since you are seeking proof of the Christ who speaks in me, who is not weak toward you, but mighty in you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For indeed He was crucified because of weakness, yet He lives because of the power of God. For we too are weak in Him, yet we will live with Him because of the power of God directed toward you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Test yourselves to see if you are in the faith; examine yourselves! Or do you not recognize this about yourselves, that Jesus Christ is in you—unless indeed you fail the test?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I expect that you will realize that we ourselves do not fail the test.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now we pray to God that you do nothing wrong; not so that we ourselves may appear approved, but that you may do what is right, though we may appear unapproved.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For we cannot do anything against the truth, but only for the truth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For we rejoice when we ourselves are weak, but you are strong; this we also pray for, that you become mature.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For this reason I am writing these things while absent, so that when present I need not use severity, in accordance with the authority which the Lord gave me for building up and not for tearing down.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Finally, brothers and sisters, rejoice, mend your ways, be comforted, be like-minded, live in peace; and the God of love and peace will be with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Greet one another with a holy kiss.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the saints greet you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The grace of the Lord Jesus Christ, and the love of God, and the fellowship of the Holy Spirit, be with you all.
verses.speaker: Narrator
